carousel_items: Takes about 8 to 12 weeks to see the medication's full effects on your mood.
You can take the extended-release form once a day with food either in the morning or in the evening at about the same time each day.
Extended-release capsules should be swallowed whole. If you can’t swallow pills, open the capsule, sprinkle it on a spoonful of applesauce and then swallow it without chewing.
Stop taking it slowly to avoid getting withdrawal symptoms.
Tell your doctor if you notice sudden mood changes or unusual thoughts.

basics.benefits_moa: Venlafaxine is a serotonin and norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor (SNRI) antidepressant. It increases serotonin and norepinephrine activity in the brain, which regulate mood.
basics.bottom_line: Venlafaxine is good for treating depression and anxiety. May work when other antidepressants haven't, it's but more likely to cause side effects and withdrawal symptoms than other antidepressants.
downsides: Can cause sexual side effects like low libido and an inability to orgasm or ejaculate.
Not the best option for people with high blood pressure.
Overdosing on this medication could be fatal.
It's more likely to cause nausea and vomiting or make you feel sick if you miss a dose than other antidepressants. Also causes more sleepiness than others.
Like most antidepressants, it can cause a higher risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior for people younger than 24.
The first antidepressant you try doesn't always work or it can cause side effects you really don't like. You might need to try a few different medications until you find one that works for you.

downsides_processed.orig: Can cause sexual side effects like low libido and an inability to orgasm or ejaculate.
Not the best option for people with high blood pressure.
Overdosing on this medication could be fatal.
It's more likely to cause nausea and vomiting or make you feel sick if you miss a dose than other antidepressants. Also causes more sleepiness than others.
Like most antidepressants, it can cause a higher risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior for people younger than 24.
The first antidepressant you try doesn't always work or it can cause side effects you really don't like. You might need to try a few different medications until you find one that works for you.

upsides: Effective at relieving depression and anxiety symptoms.
Causes more sleepiness than other antidepressants, so it's good for people who have trouble sleeping.
Six out of ten people who use an antidepressant for the first time find that it works for them.
Might work when other antidepressants haven't worked since it affects two chemicals in the brain that impact your mood. Many other antidepressants affect only serotonin, but not norepinephrine too.

upsides_processed.orig: Effective at relieving depression and anxiety symptoms.
Causes more sleepiness than other antidepressants, so it's good for people who have trouble sleeping.
Six out of ten people who use an antidepressant for the first time find that it works for them.

drugs.one_liner: Improves mood and helps you relax.

userStories.tip: After taking ,the withdrawal was excruciating. I have been drug free for 3 years and still at times get the shocky  After effects.

userStories.identifier: 37 yr. old Full time college student
userStories.tip: If you wait too long to take it, you start getting "brain zaps". Also, sometimes you get weird muscle twitches. Other than that it works well.
I wish I'd known about the withdrawal symptoms. I have a history of stopping medication on my own and the tingling after a couple days without it was absolutely unbearable.
This med made me feel normal and like myself again!!! Tried to switch to prozac because I thought effexor was affecting my vision, but now that I know that's not issue, I'm going back to effexor.

Don't take these meds!! My son's Father did an committed suiside the night before Christmas this past year!! This has devistated my son an I, I don't understand how the doctors just write this script an not know how the patient is feeling!
I sufferrd from depression terribly before effexor. Now. I have vivid, realistic nightmares, and anxiety level has risen.

I've taken Effexor XR 150mg for almost 15 years.  It is the ONLY med that works for my anxiety and I can't take the generic form. The side effect that is worst for me is night sweats. I am drenched every night.  Other than that I am pleased
the first time, made me vomit and consequently have always nauseas , that made me lose weight without help with anxiety

The withdraw is horrid, I had taken for about 5 years due to depression, went off & cried for a year till I got back on them, again for about 2 years now. Just decided I will take till I die cause makes all the difference in the world.

I wish I had known how much the side effects would get to me. If I take a dose late by even two hours I have 'brain zaps'(look it up). On 150mg, and continually building a tolerance. It's tough; I would suggest trying other stuff first.
It made me feel like a robot and kicked me into full blown mania.

Getting off of it is pure hell, as the withdrawals are terrible. However, the benefits the drug provides in fighting your anxiety and depression are great.  One should weigh the aforementioned withdrawals accordingly.

Ask for pristiq instead. your liver turns effexor into pristiq anyways. why would you bother with having the extra substance with potential extra side effects when you could go straight for the metabolite.

Worked fine, but dose had to keep increasing. Killed ability to orgasm. Missed single dose for 24hours and ended up in ER with brief psychotic break. Needed to be on Prozac to get off this: even gradual reduction w/o Prozac was horrific.

userStories.identifier: A normal fit and healthy working woman
userStories.tip: Be prepared for bad headaches, stinky sweating and muscle twitches when you first take it (different for everyone of course but my doc didn't tell me about these things).

I needed to get off of rapidly. The only way was to be admitted to a psyche hospital. I went through a horrible withdrawl. Fever, vomiting,shaking,chills. Even some hallucinations. Then I developed high anxiety. I  personally wouldn't recom
Eventually causes heart issues. Withdrawals are horrific!!! Don't start taking this med unless you completely understand what your getting yourself into!! My doctor didn't tell me....wish he did :(
Caused fatigue and memory issues over time.

Side effects for me were mild. Started taking at night & couldnt sleep. Now i take at 3pm. Much better. Started 37.5ml for a wk increased to 75ml. Im Not 100%, but feeling better. Was on Zoloft prior & it knocked me out.
Pristiq is the metabolite of Effexor - ie, Effexor is converted into pristiq by your liver. It becomes the same drug, pristiq will have less side effects
Had a heart attack & needed for depression.  Till help with hot flashes also.  Trying now to wean off, extremely slow process with dizziness and some headache.

I felt it was prescribed for mild symptoms. Excessive sweating became very restrictive for me. Hated to sit in church or in restaurant with perspiration flowing down my face and hair. I decided to wean off.

If I miss a day or take it late, I'm a real jerk. It's supposed to also help with anxiety and ocd, but it doesn't. Sexual side effects are terrible but trying to get off the meds made me horribly suicidal.

userStories.identifier: i am fighting stage four mestised breast
userStories.tip: Withdrawal sucks..tried not taking for five days. Side effects were real bad.without the medicine is worst then anything  so al in all it works good.  I just hate taking so many meds.

userStories.identifier: having hot flashes, and extreme sweats

userStories.tip: The longer I have taken it the more my body is adjusting...starting to notice new side effects, new for me but not the drug.  A killer for sexual desire and performance
It also helps with menopause.
Well worth taking the drug. Not worth it when coming off the drug. Still having minor side effects after 4 months.
I itch all over my head and face.
It will kill your entire appetite!

userStories.identifier: mom with family history of anxiety and
userStories.tip: Sexual side effects are very problematic
it's not helping me with depression

Be vigilant in noticing your moods. It can simply stop working after some time, depending on your unique body chemistry, to the point where dosage increases fail to provide even minor relief. Before then, it really can seem like a cure-all.
Almost immediate side effects from missing a dose. Cold sweat, fever, headache, jittery, extreme irritation.
I wish I would have known how bad the side effects are when you try to stop.
what are the major side effects

userStories.identifier: single mom, two kids, work full time

userStories.tip: weird side effect. the strange taste you get on the back of your throat when getting a cold.

It is horrible to get off of venlafaxine. After weeks of being off I am still LIGHT HEADED & SICK. THIS MEDICATION IS HORRIBLE AND SHOULD BE TAKEN OFF THE MARKET.  IT ALSO CAUSES WEIGHT GAIN, HIGH BLOOD PRESSURE AND A FATTY LIVER.
it makes me dizzy
Zero sex drive
Only side effects: mild nausea & sleepiness; disappears with use. Ran out once; withdrawl IS TERRIBLE
Pretty hard on the side effects terrible withdrawal symptoms, google "brain zaps". 'nuff said
userStories.identifier: Sad Student, Coping with New Things

userStories.tip: Do not miss any doses. May cause withdrawal effects

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: do not take this drug, it is not worth the risk, I got prescribed 225mg for a year for work stress, could not withdraw myself due to horrific withdrawal effects. I'm now 6 yrs off this drug and have not recovered from the horrific side effe

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: do not take this drug, it is not worth the risk, I got prescribed 225mg for a year for work stress, could not withdraw myself due to horrific withdrawal effects. I'm now 6 yrs off this drug and have not recovered from the horrific side effects
It help reduce my Fybromyalgia pains

I take it in the morning with breakfast. I so much better now. Back at work after complete breakdown and unable to work for six months. I tried three other anti depressants before trying this. Stuck with it & the initial side effects settle
Its normally just one pill, not too hard to remember to take. I take day or night and don't feel a difference, JUST DON'T MISS A DAY, you'll regret it with terrible withdrawals...
Be ready for severe constipation
This is the only depression medication that works for me.
Take it in the morning, or it'll keep you up. You will get a ton of side effects initially, but it's worth waiting then out. It's important not to miss a day.

Used to take 75mg morning and night, now just take 75mg in morning for depression and anxiety. Worked better than prozac. Citalopram had a bad effect on me. Have stopped using alcohol and feel much less depressed and anxious now.
Take in morning, increase slowly, side effects can be surprising.
Withdrawal simptons are quite crippling. Severe nauseas and diziness experienced.
Take with food in AM, same time each day. 1.5mg melatonin helps with insomnia experienced the first week of tx
hard to nap after second dose, so nap in a.m.

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: If I ever took it late, I would get a terrible stomach ache that would last all day, no matter what I did. Only thing that helped was trying to sleep it off. Also killed my sex drive. Made me me more emotionally stable, but it felt flat.

IF you take this, be forewarned. Make sure you take this medicine and do not skip doses. Doing so results in a "withdrawal" symptom of "brain zaps". Almost like little shocks when you move your head or eyes too fast.
Follow doctor's directions
It almost reduced my hot flashes to nothing but caused a bit of weight gain.

I used to take it at night, but switched to taking it in the morning. Since it lasts 24 hours, I found that if I ended up staying up later, the dosage began running low and my mood issues would begin to resurface.

userStories.identifier: college grad with a desk job
userStories.tip: I only get nauseous if I miss a dose by more than a couple hours.  Missing a day means very deep depression.  Worked better for me than Citalopram
Take it in the night if you can, it will make you sleepy. Always take with food at first, the nausea was really bad for the first few weeks
Take it at the same time every day
Started Venlafaxine as a substitute for Prozac which I had taken for 10+ years.  It works well for me.
Take it during the day before 1:00 pm because it gives you energy.

drugs.name: Effexor

carousel_items_processed.orig: Takes about 8 to 12 weeks to see the medication's full effects on your mood.
You can take the extended-release form once a day with food either in the morning or in the evening at about the same time each day.
Extended-release capsules should be swallowed whole. If you can’t swallow pills, open the capsule, sprinkle it on a spoonful of applesauce and then swallow it without chewing.
Stop taking it slowly to avoid getting withdrawal symptoms.
Tell your doctor if you notice sudden mood changes or unusual thoughts.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Venlafaxine may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Venlafaxine is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

description_processed.orig: Venlafaxine may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Venlafaxine is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition caused when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Your risk goes up if you use Venlafaxine with other medications that affect serotonin (other antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort). Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms.
risk_factors: Using other medications that affect serotonin

description_processed.orig: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition caused when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Your risk goes up if you use Venlafaxine with other medications that affect serotonin (other antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort). Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Venlafaxine suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and dizziness. Withdrawal symptoms usually occur within 3 days of stopping the medication, and go away within 1 to 2 weeks. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Venlafaxine suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and dizziness. Withdrawal symptoms usually occur within 3 days of stopping the medication, and go away within 1 to 2 weeks. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

risks_warnings.title: High blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Venlafaxine can increase your blood pressure. Monitor your blood pressure regularly.

description_processed.orig: Venlafaxine can increase your blood pressure. Monitor your blood pressure regularly.

risks_warnings.title: Increased bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Venlafaxine can increase the risk of bleeding or bruising if you're also taking aspirin, NSAIDs (like ibuprofen), warfarin, or other anticoagulants. Tell your doctor about any bruising that doesn't improve, black stools, pink or red urine, or unusual bleeding (for example, from the nose or gums).

description_processed.orig: Venlafaxine can increase the risk of bleeding or bruising if you're also taking aspirin, NSAIDs (like ibuprofen), warfarin, or other anticoagulants. Tell your doctor about any bruising that doesn't improve, black stools, pink or red urine, or unusual bleeding (for example, from the nose or gums).

risks_warnings.title: Sexual dysfunction
risks_warnings.description: Venlafaxine can cause lower sex drive or difficulty having an orgasm. If the problem persists after the first 2 to 3 months, you can talk to your doctor about alternative antidepressants or performance-enhancing medications.

description_processed.orig: Venlafaxine can cause lower sex drive or difficulty having an orgasm. If the problem persists after the first 2 to 3 months, you can talk to your doctor about alternative antidepressants or performance-enhancing medications.

risks_warnings.title: Mania
risks_warnings.description: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. Treating someone with bipolar disorder with an antidepressant alone can cause a manic episode (great excitement, euphoria, delusions, and overactivity). Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

description_processed.orig: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. Treating someone with bipolar disorder with an antidepressant alone can cause a manic episode (great excitement, euphoria, delusions, and overactivity). Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

carousel_items: Take at bedtime to avoid some of its side effects.
Can cause dizziness, drowsiness, constipation, and weight gain.
Stop taking it slowly to avoid getting withdrawal symptoms.
Tell your doctor if you notice sudden mood changes or unusual thoughts.

basics.benefits_moa: Amitriptyline is a tricyclic antidepressant (TCA). Researchers don't know exactly how it works. It may change serotonin and norepinephrine activity in the brain, which regulates mood and pain perception. It also has sedative effects.
basics.bottom_line: Amitriptyline is an older antidepressant that's sometimes used to treat pain and sleep problems, but it can have more side effects than similar medications.
downsides: When used for depression, Amitriptyline causes more side effects and has a higher risk of overdose than other antidepressants. It's usually used when other medications haven't worked.
It's more likely to cause sleepiness, nausea, constipation, diarrhea, and weight gain (1 to 5 pounds) than other antidepressants.
People age 65 and older have a higher risk for this medication's side effects.
Like most antidepressants, it can cause a higher risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior for people age 24 and younger.
The first antidepressant you try doesn't always work or it can cause side effects you really don't like. You might need to try a few different medications until you find one that works for you.

downsides_processed.orig: When used for depression, Amitriptyline causes more side effects and has a higher risk of overdose than other antidepressants. It's usually used when other medications haven't worked.
It's more likely to cause sleepiness, nausea, constipation, diarrhea, and weight gain (1 to 5 pounds) than other antidepressants.
People age 65 and older have a higher risk for this medication's side effects.
Like most antidepressants, it can cause a higher risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior for people age 24 and younger.
The first antidepressant you try doesn't always work or it can cause side effects you really don't like. You might need to try a few different medications until you find one that works for you.

upsides: Low doses work well to treat certain kinds of chronic pain. It can take 2 weeks to feel the full effects of the medication.
Low doses of Amitriptyline start working in 45 minutes to help you sleep better.
Six out of every ten people who use an antidepressant for the first time find that it works for them.

upsides_processed.orig: Low doses work well to treat certain kinds of chronic pain. It can take 2 weeks to feel the full effects of the medication.
Low doses of Amitriptyline start working in 45 minutes to help you sleep better.
Six out of every ten people who use an antidepressant for the first time find that it works for them.

drugs.one_liner: Improves mood and relieves certain kinds of pain.

userStories.tip: Could not wake up and function properly. Never again.

Start really low (5 mg) and increase slowly (5 mg increase) every week to two weeks to avoid foggy brain feeling. I took it once before and didn't do this. I quit after several weeks because of foggy brain thing. This time - no problems.
Some people use this to prevent their headaches. It works for some, but didn't for me. I'm not saying it won't be worth it for you, but I wasn't helped.
Active with familial arthritis, fibromyalgia, old injury.

userStories.identifier: 25 year old with undiagnosable hip pain
userStories.tip: Makes you really sleepy until you adjust to it.
Used to treat undiagnosable hip pain that has occurred for 8 years.
It sure works for preventing migrains but it made me gain weight.
First few weeks are disruptive but after that it works great

My migraines have reduced in frequency and duration so much that it feels like a miracle. My doctor titrated me up to 25mcg and I take it every night before I go to bed. Love it! It has given me my life back!

I'm using this to treat depression, and insomnia which was caused by my primary medication. I take half of a 5mg tablet before bed and it knocks me out. Anymore and I'm very tired the next day. It has worked perfectly for my needs.
Been an insomniac all my life. Very little results from anything else.
Helped sleep at bedtime. Not as effective as Trazodone, but kept me asleep without waking up in pain.

drugs.name: Elavil

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take at bedtime to avoid some of its side effects.
Can cause dizziness, drowsiness, constipation, and weight gain.
Stop taking it slowly to avoid getting withdrawal symptoms.
Tell your doctor if you notice sudden mood changes or unusual thoughts.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Amitriptyline may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Amitriptyline is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

description_processed.orig: Amitriptyline may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Amitriptyline is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

risks_warnings.title: Mania
risks_warnings.description: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. Treating someone with bipolar disorder with an antidepressant alone can cause a manic episode (great excitement, euphoria, delusions, and overactivity). Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

description_processed.orig: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. Treating someone with bipolar disorder with an antidepressant alone can cause a manic episode (great excitement, euphoria, delusions, and overactivity). Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Amitriptyline has a higher risk of affecting heart rate control compared to other antidepressants. If you have a history of cardiovascular disease (including previous heart attack, stroke, fast/uncontrolled heart rate, or irregular heartbeat), talk to your doctor before use.

description_processed.orig: Amitriptyline has a higher risk of affecting heart rate control compared to other antidepressants. If you have a history of cardiovascular disease (including previous heart attack, stroke, fast/uncontrolled heart rate, or irregular heartbeat), talk to your doctor before use.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Dizziness and falls may occur due to a sudden drop in blood pressure when you change positions, such as going from sitting to standing. This is called orthostatic hypotension. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change position slowly until your body is used to the medicine. If symptoms persist, a different medication may be better for you.

description_processed.orig: Dizziness and falls may occur due to a sudden drop in blood pressure when you change positions, such as going from sitting to standing. This is called orthostatic hypotension. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change position slowly until your body is used to the medicine. If symptoms persist, a different medication may be better for you.

risks_warnings.title: Anticholinergic effects
risks_warnings.description: Amitriptyline blocks acetylcholine, a nervous system chemical involved in many major bodily functions. Therefore, this medication commonly causes symptoms such as dry mouth, blurred vision, constipation, dizziness, and higher risk of falls.

description_processed.orig: Amitriptyline blocks acetylcholine, a nervous system chemical involved in many major bodily functions. Therefore, this medication commonly causes symptoms such as dry mouth, blurred vision, constipation, dizziness, and higher risk of falls.

carousel_items: Long-acting opioid for moderate to severe pain.
May not be the best choice for people who have never taken opioids, or who've only taken shorter-acting opioids for pain.
May be part of a complete program to reduce opioid dependence.
For short-term treatment of opioid dependence, the target dose is 40mg for 2-3 days, then reduced every 2 days.
For long-term drug detoxification treatment the dose is increased until withdrawal symptoms stay away for 24 hours.
Dosing can vary widely, but for most people the general range is 80-120mg daily.
Take exactly as your doctor instructs and don’t take more than you're prescribed.
Can make you dizzy or drowsy.
Avoid activities that need you to be fully alert until you know how it affects you.
Don't mix with alcohol or other sedating drugs.
Constipation is common and may not go away while you're taking this medicine. Drinking lots of water and taking laxatives can help.
Talk to your doctor if it doesn't help enough for your pain.
If you need to stop taking this medicine, work with your doctor to slowly lower your dose. It'll help you avoid withdrawal symptoms.
Careful reduction from your maintenance dose is important. It shouldn't be more than 10% of the total daily dose, reduced every 10 to 14 days.

basics.benefits_moa: Methadone is an opioid medicine (similar to morphine) that works in the brain to lower pain perception. Because withdrawal from Methadone is slower, takes longer, and is less severe than other opioids, it's used under the care of a doctor to treat opioid addiction.
basics.bottom_line: Methadone works well for moderate to severe pain especially nerve-related and complex pain and is effective for maintenance opioid addiction treatment. You need to be careful with dosing.
downsides: Need to use it “around-the-clock for pain control not “as needed”.
Even one dose is too much for child or pet and is a medical emergency so store out of their reach.
Can cause slowed breathing, coma and death from overdose, especially if you mix with other nervous system depressants.
Has a higher risk of affecting heart rate control especially if you have cardiovascular disease (previous heart attack, stroke, fast/uncontrolled heart rate, or irregular heart beat).
Can reduce your ability to focus, think, and react so avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medicine affects you.
Not safe to take if you're pregnant or breast-feeding and can increase the risk of neonatal withdrawal syndrome in women with a history of long-term opioid use.

May cause you to become tolerant (more medicine is needed to treat the same pain) and physically dependent if you’ve used it for a while so don’t stop talking it suddenly or you may feel withdrawal symptoms.
Can cause your blood pressure drop suddenly if you change positions quickly.
Certain prescription and over-the-counter medicines can change the amount of medicine in your body and cause either overdose or withdrawal.

downsides_processed.orig: Need to use it “around-the-clock for pain control not “as needed”.
Even one dose is too much for child or pet and is a medical emergency so store out of their reach.
Can cause slowed breathing, coma and death from overdose, especially if you mix with other nervous system depressants.
Has a higher risk of affecting heart rate control especially if you have cardiovascular disease (previous heart attack, stroke, fast/uncontrolled heart rate, or irregular heart beat).
Can reduce your ability to focus, think, and react so avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medicine affects you.
Not safe to take if you're pregnant or breast-feeding and can increase the risk of neonatal withdrawal syndrome in women with a history of long-term opioid use.

May cause you to become tolerant (more medicine is needed to treat the same pain) and physically dependent if you’ve used it for a while so don’t stop talking it suddenly or you may feel withdrawal symptoms.
Can cause your blood pressure drop suddenly if you change positions quickly.
Certain prescription and over-the-counter medicines can change the amount of medicine in your body and cause either overdose or withdrawal.

upsides: Relieves pain and treats opioid addiction.
Good option for people who don't get pain relief with more-common opioids, have side effects or allergies with other options, or have nerve pain (neuropathic pain).
Even low doses are more effective than placebo at treating shooting, burning pain.
Less constipating than other opioid medicines to treat pain.

Even low doses are more effective than placebo at treating shooting, burning pain.
Less constipating than other opioid medicines to treat pain.

drugs.one_liner: Treats severe pain and drug dependence.

userStories.tip: Was given this for Fibromyalgia for 6 years. WORKED INCREDIBLY. Never had to increase and could skip. Knocked depression dead in it's tracks. Had to go off after moving to another backwards state in the US.

userStories.indication: Nerve pain due to back sergury
userStories.tip: Was started on 40mg per day, in my case I cut back until I felt some pain then adjusted to relieve pain at 15mg per day. All is good, I can work, and enjoy some type of life. I have been taking for 4 years never had to increase dose.
userStories.identifier: Can't walk, run, stand or sit 24/7 pain
Chronic pain caused by post DVT syndrome
userStories.tip: Better than other opiates for me but there is stigma from people who think it's for drug addicts. Must be taken regularly (2x/day) because it takes a while to build up in body. No use breakthrough pain.

drugs.name: Methadone

carousel_items_processed.orig: Long-acting opioid for moderate to severe pain.
May not be the best choice for people who have never taken opioids, or who've only taken shorter-acting opioids for pain.
May be part of a complete program to reduce opioid dependence.
For short-term treatment of opioid dependence, the target dose is 40mg for 2-3 days, then reduced every 2 days.
For long-term drug detoxification treatment the dose is increased until withdrawal symptoms stay away for 24 hours.
Dosing can vary widely, but for most people the general range is 80-120mg daily.
Take exactly as your doctor instructs and don’t take more than you're prescribed.
Can make you dizzy or drowsy.
Avoid activities that need you to be fully alert until you know how it affects you.
Don't mix with alcohol or other sedating drugs.
Constipation is common and may not go away while you're taking this medicine. Drinking lots of water and taking laxatives can help.
Talk to your doctor if it doesn't help enough for your pain.
If you need to stop taking this medicine, work with your doctor to slowly lower your dose. It'll help you avoid withdrawal symptoms.
Careful reduction from your maintenance dose is important. It shouldn't be more than 10% of the total daily dose, reduced every 10 to 14 days.

risks_warnings.title: Death from lack of oxygen to the body (respiratory depression)
risks_warnings.description: Taking too much Methadone can cause irregular or slow breathing that can put you in a coma and can cause death. Serious breathing effects can happen after pain relief but may last longer. If your lips and fingers start turning blue from low oxygen, see a doctor immediately. In the hospital, doctors can give you a medicine that reverses the effects of Methadone. Don't take more than your doctor prescribes.
risk_factors: People with not enough thyroid hormones

description_processed.orig: Taking too much Methadone can cause irregular or slow breathing that can put you in a coma and can cause death. Serious breathing effects can happen after pain relief but may last longer. If your lips and fingers start turning blue from low oxygen, see a doctor immediately. In the hospital, doctors can give you a medicine that reverses the effects of Methadone. Don't take more than your doctor prescribes.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems (arrhythmias)
risks_warnings.description: Methadone has a higher risk of affecting heart rate control. If you have a history of cardiovascular disease (including previous heart attack, stroke, fast/uncontrolled heart rate, or irregular heartbeat), talk to your doctor before use. Seek medical attention immediately if you feel faint and have palpitations.

description_processed.orig: Methadone has a higher risk of affecting heart rate control. If you have a history of cardiovascular disease (including previous heart attack, stroke, fast/uncontrolled heart rate, or irregular heartbeat), talk to your doctor before use. Seek medical attention immediately if you feel faint and have palpitations.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Methadone lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medicine affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Methadone lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medicine affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Drug interactions
risks_warnings.description: Some medicines can affect enzymes that break down Methadone. Certain drugs to treat infections, HIV, and seizures can change the amount of Methadone in the body and cause either overdose or withdrawal. Tell your doctor about any prescription or over-the-counter medications you are taking.
risk_factors: Taking drugs that slow or stop breakdown the breakdown of Methadone

description_processed.orig: Some medicines can affect enzymes that break down Methadone. Certain drugs to treat infections, HIV, and seizures can change the amount of Methadone in the body and cause either overdose or withdrawal. Tell your doctor about any prescription or over-the-counter medications you are taking.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Methadone can cause severe low blood pressure, fainting, and a drop blood pressure when you change positions, called orthostatic hypotension. You may be more sensitive if you're already taking medicine to lower your blood pressure so be careful. It's important that you tell your doctor about these symptoms before changing your dose or stopping your medication suddenly.
risk_factors: Taking drugs that lower blood pressure

description_processed.orig: Methadone can cause severe low blood pressure, fainting, and a drop blood pressure when you change positions, called orthostatic hypotension. You may be more sensitive if you're already taking medicine to lower your blood pressure so be careful. It's important that you tell your doctor about these symptoms before changing your dose or stopping your medication suddenly.

risks_warnings.title: Neonatal withdrawal syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Methadone passes into breast milk. Women with a history of long-term opioid use increase the risk of neonatal withdrawal syndrome. Symptoms include irritability, vomiting, diarrhea, tremor and lack of weight gain. Opioid withdrawal in infants is a life-threatening emergency and needs medical help right away.
risk_factors: Long-term use of opioids in mother

description_processed.orig: Methadone passes into breast milk. Women with a history of long-term opioid use increase the risk of neonatal withdrawal syndrome. Symptoms include irritability, vomiting, diarrhea, tremor and lack of weight gain. Opioid withdrawal in infants is a life-threatening emergency and needs medical help right away.

risks_warnings.title: Death from overdose
risks_warnings.description: Even 1 dose of Methadone can be too much for a child so store out of reach from children. In adults, raising the dose too quickly, high doses or mixing with alcohol or drugs that interact causes overdose and death. If you suspect a child has taken Methadone, or an adult has taken too much, watch them for decreased activity, extreme tiredness small pupils, and lips and fingers turning blue from low oxygen. Call 911 or go to a hospital immediately. Doctors can give a medicine that reverses the effects of Methadone until the effects wear off.
risk_factors: Mixing with alcohol or drugs that interact with Methadone

description_processed.orig: Even 1 dose of Methadone can be too much for a child so store out of reach from children. In adults, raising the dose too quickly, high doses or mixing with alcohol or drugs that interact causes overdose and death. If you suspect a child has taken Methadone, or an adult has taken too much, watch them for decreased activity, extreme tiredness small pupils, and lips and fingers turning blue from low oxygen. Call 911 or go to a hospital immediately. Doctors can give a medicine that reverses the effects of Methadone until the effects wear off.

risks_warnings.title: Abuse, tolerance, and addiction
risks_warnings.description: Long-acting opioids like Methadone have a greater risk of addiction, abuse, misuse, overdose, and death. Your body can develop tolerance to Methadone, which means that more medicine is needed to treat the same pain. You can become physically dependent on Methadone if you have been using it continuously for more than 1-2 weeks, meaning you'll feel withdrawal symptoms if you stop taking it. You can avoid withdrawal by weaning off of the medication very slowly and taking the exact dose your doctor prescribed. People taking Methadone for pain with a history of drug abuse should ask their doctor about other medicine choices.
risk_factors: Taking more than the prescribed dose
History of drug abuse or mental illness.

description_processed.orig: Long-acting opioids like Methadone have a greater risk of addiction, abuse, misuse, overdose, and death. You can become physically dependent on Methadone if you have been using it continuously for more than 1-2 weeks, meaning you'll feel withdrawal symptoms if you stop taking it. You can avoid withdrawal by weaning off of the medication very slowly and taking the exact dose your doctor prescribed. People taking Methadone for pain with a history of drug abuse should ask their doctor about other medicine choices.

carousel_items: Side effects are common, but usually manageable.
Don't drive while taking Gabapentin until you know how the medication affects you.

Neurontin and generic forms of Gabapentin have the same ingredients as Gralise and Horizant, but are dosed differently. Make sure you know which form you're taking since they are used for different purposes.
Take the extended-release tablet with food.
Stop taking Gabapentin slowly over at least one week to avoid getting withdrawal symptoms.

clock.tip: Works faster and stronger when taken with food.

basics.benefits_moa: Gabapentin is an antiepileptic and nerve pain reliever. Researchers don't know exactly how it works, but it has a similar structure to GABA, a neurotransmitter that calms nerves in the brain and spinal cord.
basics.bottom_line: Gabapentin is an old seizure disorder medicine that's now used to treat nerve-related pain caused by different conditions.
downsides: Gabapentin is likely to cause some side effects, including memory problems, drowsiness, dizziness, or confusion.
You can't skip or miss doses since suddenly stopping Gabapentin can cause seizures. This is even more likely if you drink alcohol, so it might not be the best medication for heavy drinkers.

downsides_processed.orig: Gabapentin is likely to cause some side effects, including memory problems, drowsiness, dizziness, or confusion.
You can't skip or miss doses since suddenly stopping Gabapentin can cause seizures. This is even more likely if you drink alcohol, so it might not be the best medication for heavy drinkers.

upsides: Originally used to treat epilepsy (partial seizures), but now it primarily treats neuropathic pain that's caused by nerve stimulation or damage.
Studies show it's most effective for nerve pain from diabetes, shingles, and fibromyalgia (a painful muscle condition).
It's available as a generic, so it's less expensive than similar medications.

upsides_processed.orig: Originally used to treat epilepsy (partial seizures), but now it primarily treats neuropathic pain that's caused by nerve stimulation or damage.

drugs.name: Neurontin

carousel_items_processed.orig: Side effects are common, but usually manageable.
Don't drive while taking Gabapentin until you know how the medication affects you.

Neurontin and generic forms of Gabapentin have the same ingredients as Gralise and Horizant, but are dosed differently. Make sure you know which form you're taking since they are used for different purposes.
Take the extended-release tablet with food.
Stop taking Gabapentin slowly over at least one week to avoid getting withdrawal symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Gabapentin may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior as early as one week after starting treatment. Watch for the start or worsening of depression, suicidal thoughts or behavior, or any unusual changes in mood or behavior. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Gabapentin may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior as early as one week after starting treatment. Watch for the start or worsening of depression, suicidal thoughts or behavior, or any unusual changes in mood or behavior. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Neurologic and psychiatric side effects (children)
risks_warnings.description: Using Gabapentin may cause emotional ups and downs (lability), aggressive behavior, problems concentrating, restlessness, hyperactivity, and changes in school performance. When these side effects occur, they are usually mild to moderate in intensity.

description_processed.orig: Using Gabapentin may cause emotional ups and downs (lability), aggressive behavior, problems concentrating, restlessness, hyperactivity, and changes in school performance. When these side effects occur, they are usually mild to moderate in intensity.

risks_warnings.title: Serious rash and multiple organ problems
risks_warnings.description: Gabapentin has been associated with a serious rash and multiple organ problems known as Drug Reaction with Eosinophilia and Systemic Symptoms (DRESS). It can be life-threatening. Call a doctor immediately if you experience: fever, rash, hives, swollen glands, lip or tongue swelling, yellowing of skin or whites of the eyes, unusual bruising or bleeding, severe fatigue or weakness, unexpected muscle pain, frequent infections.

description_processed.orig: Gabapentin has been associated with a serious rash and multiple organ problems known as Drug Reaction with Eosinophilia and Systemic Symptoms (DRESS). It can be life-threatening. Call a doctor immediately if you experience: fever, rash, hives, swollen glands, lip or tongue swelling, yellowing of skin or whites of the eyes, unusual bruising or bleeding, severe fatigue or weakness, unexpected muscle pain, frequent infections.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Gabapentin impairs thinking abilities (concentration, alertness) and physical abilities (reflexes, motor skills) needed to drive a car, operate machinery, or participate in potentially dangerous activities. Be careful.

description_processed.orig: Gabapentin impairs thinking abilities (concentration, alertness) and physical abilities (reflexes, motor skills) needed to drive a car, operate machinery, or participate in potentially dangerous activities. Be careful.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal seizures
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Gabapentin suddenly can increase the number of seizures. Talk to your doctor before making any changes to your medication. It's safer to reduce the dose slowly over at least one week before stopping medication.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Gabapentin suddenly can increase the number of seizures. Talk to your doctor before making any changes to your medication. It's safer to reduce the dose slowly over at least one week before stopping medication.

carousel_items: For the first week, avoid activities that require you to be alert.
Report skin rashes or blistering immediately.
Don't use if pregnant.
Requires routine blood tests.
Report confusion, persistent abdominal pain, yellowing of eyes/skin, or easy bruising to your doctor.
Takes up to 5 weeks to feel full effects on mood.

basics.benefits_moa: Tegretol is an antiepileptic. Researchers don't know exactly how it works, but it seems to block certain kinds of nerve activity to reduce seizures and pain.
basics.bottom_line: Tegretol is useful for preventing seizures and relieving certain types of nerve pain, but interacts with many drugs.
downsides: Interacts with many other medicines and supplements.
Higher risk of skin reactions compared to other antiepileptic medicines, ranging from mild to life-threatening rash.
Can cause blurry vision, dizziness, and upset stomach.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.
Requires routine blood tests to see how the medicine is affecting your body.

downsides_processed.orig: Interacts with many other medicines and supplements.
Higher risk of skin reactions compared to other antiepileptic medicines, ranging from mild to life-threatening rash.
Can cause blurry vision, dizziness, and upset stomach.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.
Requires routine blood tests to see how the medicine is affecting your body.

upsides: Lowers the frequency of seizures, especially for people with tonic-clonic and partial seizures.
First-line option for trigeminal neuralgia (nerve pain involving the face, head, and neck), and can relieve other types of nerve pain.
May be helpful in stabilizing mood for people with bipolar disorder.

upsides_processed.orig: Lowers the frequency of seizures, especially for people with tonic-clonic and partial seizures.
First-line option for trigeminal neuralgia (nerve pain involving the face, head, and neck), and can relieve other types of nerve pain.
May be helpful in stabilizing mood for people with bipolar disorder.

drugs.one_liner: Prevents seizures, stabilizes mood, and relieves nerve pain.

userStories.tip: How dependent I am on it. The pain is terrifying .

If the medicine is causing a rash, there are many topical steroids that will keep it under control- or vanquish it completely. I get the rash on my face- so when my doc prescribed fluocinolone, it oil changed my life.
make it part of your beauty routine etc so that you won't forget to take it. Always make sure you have enough and if on holiday, be sure to take a prescription along

drugs.name: Tegretol

carousel_items_processed.orig: For the first week, avoid activities that require you to be alert.
Report skin rashes or blistering immediately.
Don't use if pregnant.
Requires routine blood tests.
Report confusion, persistent abdominal pain, yellowing of eyes/skin, or easy bruising to your doctor.
Takes up to 5 weeks to feel full effects on mood.

risks_warnings.title: Serious skin rash
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Tegretol can cause a serious or life-threatening skin rash. The risk is higher for people who are also taking Depakote. If you are of Asian descent, you may need a genetic test to find out if you have a gene that causes increased risk. Report any skin rashes to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Tegretol can cause a serious or life-threatening skin rash. The risk is higher for people who are also taking Depakote. If you are of Asian descent, you may need a genetic test to find out if you have a gene that causes increased risk. Report any skin rashes to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Blood disorders
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Tegretol can cause an increased risk for blood disorders. Your blood may be tested on a regular basis to see if it has low white blood cells (for fighting infections) or platelets (for blood clotting).

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Tegretol can cause an increased risk for blood disorders. Your blood may be tested on a regular basis to see if it has low white blood cells (for fighting infections) or platelets (for blood clotting).

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Tegretol may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Tegretol may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Tegretol can cause serious allergic reactions and life-threatening organ failure. You may need a genetic test to find out if you have a gene that causes increased risk. Report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Tegretol can cause serious allergic reactions and life-threatening organ failure. You may need a genetic test to find out if you have a gene that causes increased risk. Report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Pregnancy
risks_warnings.description: Tegretol may cause birth defects. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

description_processed.orig: Tegretol may cause birth defects. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

risks_warnings.title: Mental changes due to low sodium
risks_warnings.description: Tegretol may cause low sodium in the body (hyponatremia), especially in people who are older. Tell your doctor if you notice any confusion, headache, memory problems, difficulty concentrating, weakness, or falls.

description_processed.orig: Tegretol may cause low sodium in the body (hyponatremia), especially in people who are older. Tell your doctor if you notice any confusion, headache, memory problems, difficulty concentrating, weakness, or falls.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal seizures
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Tegretol suddenly can increase the number of seizures. If you want to stop taking Tegretol, talk to your doctor before making any changes. It’s safer to slowly lower your dose of the drug over at least one week before completely stopping.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Tegretol suddenly can increase the number of seizures. If you want to stop taking Tegretol, talk to your doctor before making any changes. It’s safer to slowly lower your dose of the drug over at least one week before completely stopping.
